comments.text: Currently persistence considers urls like chrome://global/content#foo and chrome://hlobal/content#bar as different and so persists different data. It should consider them as the same.
comments.creator: dtownsend@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text: Currently persistence considers urls like chrome://global/content#foo and chrome://hlobal/content#bar as different and so persists different data. It should consider them as the same.
comments.author: dtownsend@mozilla.com

comments.raw_text: Fairly straightforward stuff. We just want to consider only the part of the URL before the first # for persistence purposes so everything after gets stripped off whenever persisting values or retrieving persisted values. The test case cycles through cases for chrome: and about: to verify that persistence works.
comments.creator: dtownsend@mozilla.com
comments.text:
Created attachment 518587
patch rev 1

Fairly straightforward stuff. We just want to consider only the part of the URL before the first # for persistence purposes so everything after gets stripped off whenever persisting values or retrieving persisted values. The test case cycles through cases for chrome: and about: to verify that persistence works.
comments.author: dtownsend@mozilla.com

comments.text:
Comment on attachment 518587
patch rev 1

Why not use existing url functionality for this instead of reinventing the parsing wheel?

And note that if mDocumentURI is a jar: URI this code is just wrong.  Consider:

  jar:file:///home/me/foo.jar#bar!/baz.html#woops
comments.creator: bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.raw_text:
